WRITING.TEXT:
Agreed. There was not enough lavender in either of their outfits to suggest a Ro wedding. You know if he got married Mateo would be ring bearer in a lavender tux.
Edit: Actually, I'm rewatching the scene and Mateo is wearing a lavender tie...

Yeah, I'm looking forward to some Alba/Jane time since they are both widows now /3
I can't remember which episode, but we did see Alba on Mateo Sr's birth/death day (?) lock herself in what looked like the same room Jane was in during the preview for next week. Hopefully Jane will let Alba be there for her even though Alba couldn't at the time
This is *exactly* how I feel. And now with Rose being responsible for Michael's death, I just want her gone!
Same! I stayed up into the morning until it came on the cw website because I needed it.
I love when Petra and Jane interact, so I'm all for your theory!
Welcome to the sub! My mom and sister aren't caught up either and it's killingggg me.
I'm going to be pissed if it's Louisa and Rose's wedding, even if Rose is still in disguise. I do not want to see Jane attending/celebrating the marriage of the woman responsible for Michael's death.
Nooooooooooo

Wasn't Petra supposed to get a new love interest this season? It could be her wedding with a character we haven't met before. Unless we consider Vests that new love interest since he thought Anezka was Petra originally
She said that this was planned to happen around the midpoint, so I wonder how many more seasons we will get
Dang, that's a good point... Maybe it's a mixture of plot/baby force?
Technically, he did spend the rest of his life with her...

I saw all the casts' tweets about needing to watch live and how this episode was so important. I tried to stay off social media, but I accidentally pulled up insta. I saw Gina's post, tried to scroll down past it, only to end up on Brett's post. I didn't read anything, but I figured this would be the one :(

I bet you anything though that Jane is going to be pregnant with Michael's baby. We know they had sex the night before, it's a classic telenovela move, and I just need some part of Michael to live on (RIP #crying) :'(
We're going to get so many more feels next week. I wonder if they are going to go with a Alba/Mateo and Jane/Michael parallel kind of thing
RIP Bromance

I agree. I felt like the show had just run out of drama and emotion. Everything that has happened this season so far, I haven't really been invested in. Darci, Vests, Catalina, Sam, Anezka, Bruce, etc. I don't care about them! I want more Alba, more Petra, more Jane!
So that's why the cast was hyping the episode so much :'(
I knew it going to happen as soon as we saw baby Michael in his Halloween costume /3
That just happened
Are you fucking kidding me
It looks like all of the terror attacks in the list in the US were committed by US citizens. Obviously, we need to ban US citizens from the US to prevent more terror attacks.
Sally Yates for Georgia governor!

They're doing a four year jump?! What!
They got bizzzzy
Right? Poor Petra!
So I saw your comment before I watched the episode and I legit thought that Jane was going to be flirting with someone called Mr Bee
Look at Jane, shopping somewhere that isn't Target.
Oh, shit! I totally thought it was Anezka!
Every time Jane tries to talk to Michael about something in this episode, he changes the subject. Listen to your wife, man!

Yay for Catalina for telling Rafael right away!
I love when Ro speaks Spanish with Alba 3
Ro with a man bun tho...
Jane just makes the best faces on the show.
Seconded!

Dang, you're right. My bad!
Also, totally random: Are you Norwegian?
Why on earth was Moana released in December?

281,235. That's how many miles my '96 Ranger had on it before I sold it. It finally got too expensive to repair, and my parents wanted me to have a safer car since I lived out of state by myself. I miss my Ranger so much.
Can any immediate family members of the President be serving in any of the forces while the President is in office? Like their wife/husband or any children?
Young Ro is too precious for words.
Or Sterling Brown!

WRITING.TITLE: Virginity Talk w/ Idina Menzel Gina Rodriguez

WRITING.TEXT: When Petra was married to Rafael, they suffered from a late-term miscarriage, so Petra at one point did want to have a baby with Rafael.

I'm going to guess a similar ratio to those in Arizona where the racial profiling law was passed?
I know statically she will be fine, but my sister is the type to join protests and stand up for her beliefs. I have some cause to worry, and it helps that I can express that fear with others.

I'm worried that Republican states will pass laws encouraging racial profiling. I'm worried that my sister will be harassed by people who will only see the color of her skin and react negatively. I'm worried that my sister will forget her driver's license one day, be pulled over because of her brown skin, and will react impulsively because that's just who she is.

Did you mean to respond to my comment? I only ask because I didn't say that I was afraid of the world thinking we were bigots. Lord knows it's not the first time America was viewed negatively by other countries. I was raising my concerns about state legislature that may cause some supporters of President-elect Trump to act out and terrorize others who they see as different or lesser.
But to address your comment, I don't think it's okay for our leaders to be corrupt, but I do not believe that Clinton is a criminal. She has never been convicted of a crime, and I trust that the FBI knows a lot more than I do when it comes to her actions. Again, her policies lined up best for me, so I voted for her.

Exactly! I live in Georgia and I'm so grateful that the religious freedom bill was vetoed, but if states know that the federal government under a Trump administration will leave them be, then that's where I fear the problems will arise.

I respect that. Because that's exactly why I voted for Clinton. Her policy goals lined up best for me and I truly believe that her environmental goals were the best for everybody.
What I don't respect and what I'm against is the rhetoric President-elect Trump used during his campaign and how some of his user base is responding. That's something we agree on. I don't want discriminatory laws passed in the states that lead to citizens feeling like it's okay to terrorize people. That's what I'm against and to be honest, slightly afraid of.
That is very true.

I am listening to you. I am listening to you insult me. I am listening to you insult me multiple times. I hear you, but insults will not make me change my mind. I think that's something both "sides" need to learn.
I apologize if you think I was being smug. That wasn't my intention. I do feel bad for you that you immediately reject any kind of sympathy or attempt at reasoning and again I honestly hope that you stop feeling so sad.
You can think that my perceived superiority is a turnoff to others. That's okay. That's what I love about this country and what I love about you. You are exercising your right to express yourself, just as I am. Your voice and vote counts just as much as mine does.
